model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Have you found out any more ideas for what you would like to do on your Alaska trip with your friends?
Speaker B: I am thinking I might want to do sledding with dogs while I am there, but I need to figure out if it is daylight or darkness in Alaska right now. My friend says they don't have 24 hour days like we do.
Speaker A: You mean they have different daylight and darkness times? That would be cool to see. If it's dark, I'm sure you could go camping somewhere and get some really great views of the stars.
Speaker B: Yeah, I think they go dark for a couple months and then have daylight for a couple months! I actually like night time, but having daylight all the time will make me crazy lol. Yeah I kind of hope it's dark for the camping but it will be very cold. I have heard Alaska has delicious ice cream. I want to try that while I'm there, 
Speaker A: You'd have to get some serious blackout curtains for when it was daylight lol! You'll have to stock up on some warm essentials before heading out. You definitely don't want to get stuck in a bad situation in the cold, especially if you're alone. I bet they have great ice cream! You'll have to tell me about it when you get back!
Speaker B: Yeah, I need to call my friend and find out what season they are in so I can pack accordingly. I will take pictures of the ice cream too so I can tell you about it. I wonder if there are a lot of bears there? I don't like bears either.
Speaker A: I'm pretty sure they have grizzlies up there. You better pack something to fend them off too just in case. I bet your friend knows everything you'd need to keep them away.
Speaker B: I will bring whatever they let me bring on the airplane, but I am really counting on my friend to help me out with the local customs lol. Do you know if Rocky and Bullwinkle were from Alaska? 
Speaker A: No, they were from Minnesota. Are you going to have your friend be your hiking guide?
Speaker B: I invited my friend to come stay at the lodge where I'm vacationing and he said it would be fun to get away for a bit. So I'm hoping he will show me around for a week or so. I might have to hire a hiking guide, it depends on how much he knows about hiking and grizzlies I think. What do you think? Should I hire someone?
Speaker A: I think it could be a good idea, especially with all the large animals in Alaska and the terrain. I wouldn't rely on your friend and have someone more professional that knows a lot just in case. I'm sure the guide could also give you tons of suggestions of things to do while in the area, and maybe even the best ice cream places lol!

MEMORY:
Speaker B is going to Alaska for a vacation in two weeks and has some experience with flying on airplanes. Speaker A is familiar with Alaska and outdoor activities like fishing and hiking. Speaker A mentions the outdoor activities they plan to do in Alaska, such as hiking. 
Speaker A and Speaker B share a sense of humor and make each other laugh during the conversation. Speaker A is familiar with Alaska and outdoor activities like fishing and hiking. Speaker B is unsure about what else there is to do in Alaska besides hiking. 
Speaker A is familiar with Alaska and outdoor activities like fishing and hiking. Speaker B is going to Alaska for a vacation in two weeks and has some experience with flying on airplanes. Speaker A and Speaker B are planning a trip to Alaska together.

raw_prediction: Yeah, I think it might be a good idea to hire a hiking guide, just to be safe. I'll ask my friend if he knows of any good ones in the area. I want to make sure I have a great time on this trip!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The MEMORY contains some relevant information about Speaker B's upcoming trip to Alaska and mentions their flying experience, which aligns with the DISCUSSION CONTEXT where they talk about planning the trip, flying, and considering the time of travel according to daylight hours in Alaska. Additionally, it confirms Speaker A's familiarity with outdoor activities in Alaska, which mirrors their suggested activities. However, MEMORY mentions Speaker A and B planning a trip together, which is inaccurate as both are not going together. Overall, MEMORY carries some useful details about their plans and experiences, though not entirely accurate concerning them both traveling together.

Judgement: Yes
